task.title: Fastening the seat belts
task.shortdesc: Ensure the driver and passenger seat belts are correclty adjusted, and always keep seat belts fastened while driving to reduce your chance of being injured in an accident.

context.p: Seat belts are adjustable, and should fit snugly across your hips and chest.

fig.title: A driver with a correctly fastened seatbelt.

image.alt: A driver with a correctly fastened seatbelt

step.cmd: Adjust the short belt until the attached buckle is located just in front of your hip.
Adjust the long belt so that the buckle tongue is approximately at the belt centre.
Push the buckle tongue on the long belt into the buckle on the short belt.
step.stepresult: The buckle makes an audible click when is fastened.

step.cmd: Adjust the long belt until the waist portion is comfortably tight and it is just possible to slide a hand between the upper part of the belt and your chest.
